environment.bus_stop Module¶

class environment.bus_stop.StopFinder¶

Bases: object

Class to find bus stops and calculate distances.

Todo

use manhatan distance from utilities class

__init__() → None¶

Initialize the StopFinder class.

find_begin_stop(begin_loc, loc_dic, con)¶

Find the nearest bus stop to the beginning location.

Parameters:

  • begin_loc – The beginning location.

  • loc_dic – A dictionary of location coordinates.

  • con – SUMO connection.

Returns:

The nearest bus stop lane.

find_bus_locs()¶

Find bus stop locations.

Returns:

A list of bus stop locations.

find_end_stop(end_loc, loc_dic, con)¶

Find the nearest bus stop to the end location.

Parameters:

  • end_loc – The end location.

  • loc_dic – A dictionary of location coordinates.

  • con – SUMO connection.

Returns:

The nearest bus stop lane.

get_line(stop_id)¶

Get the bus line for a given stop.

Parameters:

stop_id – The bus stop ID.

Returns:

The bus line associated with the stop.

get_line_route(con)¶

Get the route edges for a bus line.

Parameters:

con – SUMO connection.

Returns:

A list of edges for the bus route.

Todo

get a better way to do this with out hard coding the bus ID

get_stop_dists(loc, loc_dic)¶

Get distances from a location to all bus stops.

Parameters:

  • loc – The location to calculate distances from.

  • loc_dic – A dictionary of location coordinates.

Returns:

A dictionary of bus stop distances.

manhat_dist(x1, y1, x2, y2)¶

Calculate the Manhattan distance between two points.

Parameters:

  • x1 – Coordinates of the first point.

  • y1 – Coordinates of the first point.

  • x2 – Coordinates of the second point.

  • y2 – Coordinates of the second point.

Returns:

The Manhattan distance between the two points.
